Topic: Draw reversible and irreversible changes (ice melting vs. egg cooking)
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a picture showing the characteristics of ice before and after it melts, and how it can freeze back into ice.
The student can draw a picture showing how heating an egg causes it to cook and change, and how it cannot go back to being raw.
The student can illustrate an example of a material that changes with heating, like chocolate melting and then solidifying differently.
The student can show a clear difference between reversible changes (like water freezing and melting) and irreversible changes (like a cooked egg).
The student can include drawings that explain cause and effect, showing how heating and cooling cause changes, and identify if these changes are reversible or irreversible.
